almost.functional

Class Predicates

  • java.lang.Object
    • almost.functional.Predicates

  • public class Predicates
extends Object
    Utility operations on predicates.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Predicate<T> and(Predicate<? super T> first, Predicate<? super T> second)
      Create a predicate which is a logical and of two existing predicate.
      static <T> Predicate<T> contains(Iterable<T> iterable)
      Returns a predicate that that tests if an iterable contains an argument.
      static <T> Predicate<T> isEqual(T targetRef)
      Returns a predicate that tests if two arguments are equal according to Objects.equals(Object, Object).
      static <T> Predicate<T> negate(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
      Negate an existing predicate's test result.
      static <T> Predicate<T> or(Predicate<? super T> first, Predicate<? super T> second)
      Create a predicate which is a logical or of two existing predicate.

    • Method Detail

      • isEqual

        public static <T> Predicate<T> isEqual(T targetRef)
        Returns a predicate that tests if two arguments are equal according to Objects.equals(Object, Object).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of arguments to the predicate
        Parameters:
        targetRef - the object reference with which to compare for equality, which may be null
        Returns:
        a predicate that tests if two arguments are equal according to Objects.equals(Object, Object)

      • contains

        public static <T> Predicate<T> contains(Iterable<T> iterable)
        Returns a predicate that that tests if an iterable contains an argument.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the argument to the predicate
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable, may not be null
        Returns:
        a predicate that that tests if an iterable contains an argument

      • negate

        public static <T> Predicate<T> negate(Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Negate an existing predicate's test result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - An existing predicate.
        Returns:
        new predicate.
        Since:
        1.5

      • and

        public static <T> Predicate<T> and(Predicate<? super T> first,
                   Predicate<? super T> second)
        Create a predicate which is a logical and of two existing predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the predicates
        Parameters:
        first - first predicate.
        second - second predicate.
        Returns:
        resultant predicate
        Since:
        1.5
